author: financialcontent.com
title: Hire Smarter, Grow Faster: Free Job Board & Targeted Referrals Fuel PT Practice Success with Physical Therapy Near Me | FinancialContent Business Page
text:
Apex, NC - December 29, 2023 - Stop the hiring hustle and patient chase! Physical Therapy Near Me, the #1 PT directory in the US, announces a game-changing duo: a free Job Board for top-tier talent and laser-targeted patient referrals. It's time to ignite your practice growth with the platform designed for helping you grow your practice with new patient referrals and now, enabling smarter recruiting and hiring.
The Hiring Headache Ends Here:
For directory members, Physical Therapy Near Me’s new Job Board eliminates endless resumes and generic applications. Physical therapy practices can now list all of their open positions for FREE – therapists, athletic trainers, interns, support staff – and watch qualified candidates come knocking (virtually, of course!). Say goodbye to recruitment black holes; candidates contact you directly, saving you time and stress. And guess what? 90% of practices listed on our directory see qualified inquiries within the first month!
But wait, there's more!
Physical Therapy Near Me, the best PT directory in the U.S., helps get you the right patients to fill your schedule. We've upgraded our powerful referral engine to connect you with individuals actively seeking care near your practice who perfectly match your specialties. It's like having a built-in marketing machine focused on sending you ideal patients you actually want to treat all for a fraction of the cost of traditional marketing.
Imagine this:
Top-tier talent flooding your Job Board inbox.
Ideal patients knocking on your virtual door.
A thriving practice built on the power of targeted referrals and candidate attraction.
List Your PT Practice on Physical Therapy Near Me and unlock a world of possibilities:
Free Job Board listings for all your open positions.
Enhanced patient referrals matching your practice and specialties.
Boosted profile visibility, ranking you higher in patient searches.
Streamlined communication with candidates and potential patients.
A thriving practice fueled by high-quality talent and ideal referrals.
Ready to ditch the hiring hassles and attract the perfect patients?
Head over to https://www.physicaltherapynearme.co/join and become a member. Experience the magic of a directory that works for you – both in finding the best talent and getting the right patients through your door.
Don't just survive, thrive with Physical Therapy Near Me! The future of PT success is here.
Quote: from physical therapist:
"As a PT clinic owner, finding the right talent has always been a headache. Sifting through generic resumes and hoping for a good fit felt like searching for a needle in a haystack. But Physical Therapy Near Me's new Job Board changes everything! Now, I can list my open positions for free and reach qualified candidates actively seeking PT roles near my practice. It's like having a built-in talent magnet! Honestly, I wish this platform existed years ago. It's a game-changer for finding the perfect team members who share my passion for patient care." - A. Koonin, DPT
Quote: from Darren Witmer, Physical Therapy Near Me Directory Co-Founder:
"The days of struggling to find the perfect fit are over. Physical Therapy Near Me is redefining how practices and patients connect. With our new free Job Board and laser-targeted referrals, growth isn't optional, it's inevitable. We are all about adding continuous value to the PT practices who list on our directory. The talent shortage has been a huge problem for them and we’re excited to help them solve it.”
Boilerplate:
Physical Therapy Near Me, the #1 online directory for connecting patients with the perfect PT in the US, empowers both sides of the equation. Patients across the Southeast can seamlessly search hundreds of qualified practices by location, insurance, and specialty, while PTs leverage targeted referrals and boosted visibility to attract ideal clients. This thriving ecosystem ensures patients find the care they need and PT practices flourish with empowered growth. Visit Physical Therapy Near Me today and experience the magic of connection and healing.
https://www.physicaltherapynearme.co/home
 Physical Therapy Near Me

author: VNExplorer
title: Storm and flood recovery 'stretched' amid heatwave
text:
Parts of Queensland have been smashed by multiple extreme weather events and will take time to recover, a federal minister has warned.
The state was hit by flooding, tornado-like winds and rain that claimed the lives of seven people in the days after Christmas.
Tens of thousands of homes around the Gold Coast are entering a fourth day without power with heatwave conditions forecast on Friday.
Federal Emergency Management Minister Murray Watt said some suburbs’ power networks have been “completely smashed”.
Some suburbs’ power networks have been “completely smashed”, federal minister Murray Watt said. (JASON O’BRIEN/AAP PHOTOS)
“The scale of the damage that we’ve seen across a pretty big part of southeast Queensland is very large and therefore is going to take some time to work through,” Senator Watt said.
He said emergency services had been stretched by flooding in Cairns and far north Queensland followed immediately by storms in the southeast.
“When you’re dealing with disasters from one end of the state to the other, literally, that is a real test for people and there’s an incredible work being put in,” Senator Watt said.
Port Douglas residents and businesses were told to stop using water immediately on Friday after a landslide halted operations at a treatment plant.
Douglas Shire chief executive Scott Mason said the council was working around the clock to alleviate the issue as quickly as possible.
Federal Nationals leader David Littleproud warned that Australia was only just at the start of the disaster season.
“We’ve got a lot of recovery to do in fixing a lot of roads, a lot of infrastructure and helping farmers out who have lost a lot of produce,” he said.
“If they haven’t provided the right warnings with the right information at the right time, then questions should be asked,” Mr Littleproud said.
Temperatures are expected to soar across most of northern Australia over the coming days.
Parts of Queensland, the Northern Territory and Western Australia face extreme to severe heatwave conditions from Friday, the Bureau of Meteorology says.
On Friday in the Northern Territory, it’s predicted to reach 40C in Katherine and 43C in Tennant Creek.
Marble Bar in WA’s Pilbara region may reach 49C on Saturday, and temperatures up to 45C are expected there for the next six days.
Winton in Queensland’s west is expecting 43C, while temperatures up to 37C are forecast for Gympie in the state’s storm-ravaged southeast.
Highs up to 36C are predicted in Brisbane on Friday, while Longreach in the state’s west is forecast to get to 47C over the weekend.
More than 42,000 people remained without power across southeast Queensland on Thursday as the state recorded higher than average temperatures.
“In the Northern Territory, low to severe-intensity heatwave conditions cover most areas,” the bureau said in a statement.
“Locally, extreme heatwave levels are forecast around Darwin where warm minimums are leading to uncomfortable nights.
“In Queensland, low to locally severe heatwave conditions are building along the east coast, including Brisbane, the Sunshine Coast and areas surrounding Cairns.”
Forecasters say people in the worst impacted areas should stay indoors, close windows and blinds to keep heat out of homes and seek out fans or air-conditioners to keep cool.

author: Anna-Maria Bayer
title: „Die Legende geht": Kult-Club in Bayern schließt für immer
text:
„Die Legende geht“: Kult-Club in Bayern schließt für immer – Letzte Party am Wochenende
Das Clubsterben geht unaufhaltsam weiter. Die Schließung eines unterfränkischen Kult-Clubs sorgt für Bestürzung. Es wird noch eine letzte Party geben.
Unterpreppach – Über Jahrzehnte lockte der bayerische Club in Unterpreppach im Landkreis Haßberge Besucher zu zahlreichen Partys an. Doch jetzt ist Schluss damit.
Kaiser in Unterpreppenbach schließt: Clubsterben in Bayern geht auch in Unterfranken weiter
„Dieses Wochenende heißt es: ein letztes Mal Brille richten und durchdrehen.“ Das teilt der Kult-Club Kaiser auf seinen sozialen Kanälen mit. Die Tore des unterfränkischen Tempels werden sich unter dem Motto „Der letzte Kaiser – Die Legende geht“ nur noch einmal öffnen, „bevor das Partyreich in die Geschichtsbücher eingeht“. Auf Facebook zeigen sich die Nutzer bestürzt. Einer kann es gar nicht glauben und fragt, ob das eine Sommerpause sein soll.
„Hört der Kaiser wirklich auf“, stellt jemand mit einem weinenden Emoji fest. Ein anderer Nutzer teilt, dass er dort sozusagen seine Jugend mit vielen schönen Erinnerungen verbracht habe. „Macht ihr jetzt wirklich für immer zu?“, lautet die ungläubige Frage. Die Antwort liefert ein weiterer Kommentar: „Hat mich sowieso gewundert, dass sie den Laden so lange halten konnten. Das Clubsterben geht unaufhaltsam weiter.“
„Der letzte Kaiser“ – Kult-Club in Bayern hört auf und schmeißt am Wochenende die letzte Party
Zum Abschluss lädt der Kaiser am Samstag, 26. April, noch einmal zu einer rauschenden Partynacht ein. Laut Angaben des Nachtclubs wird DJ Bump für Stimmung sorgen. Die Besucher können ein letztes Mal zu den Hits aus den 1990er-, 2000er-, 2010er-Jahren sowie zur Musik der Neuzeit feiern. Nach unzähligen Veranstaltungen über Jahrzehnte bleibe nur noch einmal: „Vollgas – denn das Beste kommt zum Schluss!“
(Übrigens: Unser Bayern-Newsletter informiert Sie täglich über alle wichtigen Geschichten aus Bayern. Jetzt nach einer kurzen Registrierung bei unserem Medien-Login USER.ID anmelden.)
Zur finalen Nacht gibt‘s in der Disco Geschenke – „alles muss raus“
Außerdem muss laut einem Instagram-Beitrag des Unterpreppenbacher Nachtclubs „alles raus“. Früh kommen lohne sich, denn der Kaiser leert sein Geschenkelager, in dem sich unter anderem Salitos-Hüte, Sonnenbrillen und Handtücher befinden. Die finale Nacht mit dem letzten Tanz im Kaiser soll laut Facebook-Post laut, wild und unvergesslich werden.
An der U-Bar kümmert sich DJ M. Thudt um gebührende Party-Musik für einen beeindruckenden Abschluss. Der Einlass beginnt um 21 Uhr, Zutritt haben alle Personen ab 16 Jahren. Für die letzte Feiermöglichkeit im Kaiser beträgt der Eintritt 7 Euro. Ein Facebook-Nutzer kommentiert: „Da muss man nochmal hin.“
